ygData.subject: Re: Camping, a solution
ygData.msgSnippet: Warriors are not solo ers, plain and simple.  We require a cleric to be really usefull.  And at later levels we need a wizard to do the majority of the damage.
ygData.messageBody:
Warriors are not solo'ers, plain and simple. We require a cleric to be
really usefull. And at later levels we need a wizard to do the majority of
the damage. BUT at the same time, wizards need us to keep the monsters off
of them so they can cast their spells. All in all I gotta give verant 2
thumbs up on their design, the classes are pretty well balanced, no one
class is really any more powerfull than any other class (due to each classes
weaknesses), every group pretty much relies upon 3 things, a tank, a cleric,
and a wizard.

As for the PvP server, well, wizards defintially have some advantages
there....but thats another story I don't care to get into.

as for us being weak offensivly....well thats debatable, at least when
talking about group play non pvp. Sure we don't actually dish out the
damage, but we make it possible for the casters to be able to dish out the
damage, so looking at it that way, we have tremendous offensive powers. As
they say, a good defense is the best offense, and NO BODY can match a
warriors defensive tanking power :)

> In RPGs, my heart and soul has always fit that of a warrior. But, having
> played a warrior to level 12 on Zek, and having suffered
> countless setbacks
> there, mostly but not exclusively involving PKs (one time 2
> yellow wizards
> wiped my level 11's full hps out in less than ten seconds after rooting),
> I've come to the conclusion that warriors are, more than anyone
> else, forced
> to wear and use the juiciest items to obtain xp while at the same
> being the
> most vulnerable (after we've used our hps to get xp, non-hiders
> are out of
> options without spell-casting bodyguards) and least
> dangerous/flexible/useful
> of the classes. Furthermore, if/when we do get an advantage against an
> enemy, we're really bad at actually finishing them off (escaping
> from us with
> impunity is a big option).
>
> I've heard some very encouraging things from some of you more successful
> folks contradicting my conclusions and I'd like to hear more. I'm not so
> much concerned with the PKers as I am concerned that a party of
> four wizards,
> a magician and a necro might just be slowed down by a warrior tank (best
> defense = good offense + we seem to suck at offense more than
> most casters
> w/pets suck at defense, etc.) Many other classes could fit into
> that group
> and be less of a drag, I think...
>
> I'm not at all interested in theories or how things look on paper
> from people
> who've farted around like I have to 12th or even 16th level. I am more
> interested in hearing how things are actually working/not working
> for us in
> the grand scheme of things before I can seriously committ to
> trying to make
> my warrior work in this game and on RZ.
>
> Thanks,
>
> -A disgruntled former barb
